citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC), National Marine Mammal Laboratory (NMML)
citeinfo.title: Steller Sea Lion Locations

descript.abstract: Data Type: Mammals; National Marine Fisheries, Marine Mammal Lab in cooperation with the Alaska Department of Fish and Game collects and catalogs location data for sea lion rookeries and haulouts and critical habitats and collects associated data pertaining to ongoing research on population study, wintering habitats, annual pup counts, and studies related to rookeries, behavior, tagging, reproduction, and feeding Satellite radio telemetry data is also collected in the eastern Gulf of Alaska, at Cape St. Elias, Kodiak and in Southeast Alaska. A variety of systems such as ARC/INFO and CAMRIS (Computer Aided Mapping and Resources Inventory System) and various database systems have been used to store and analyze this data over time. As of 1994, the Alaska Department of Fish and Game has launched an effort to begin using ARC/INFO to analyze the distribution and abundance data to evaluate sea lion critical habitats. This data is the GIS application of the same data set in National Marine Fisheries, Marine Fisheries Lab, metadata record #070.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
